comments.comment: I love how Felix just turned into a family blogging channel. it’s honestly heart warming to see him grow into the good man he is today.
4:00 Felix randomly complementing Marzia's hair is so wholesome I feel so happy for them
A Swedish man and Italian woman moving to Japan is the most love story thing I’ve ever seen
I like how often Felix is like “Marzia! Come look at this random thing!” So wholesome
I love how he respect people by really trying not to accidentally film strangers. There are many foreign vlogger in japan that aren't even trying to do that

"Your hair looks amazing girl" sometimes I forget how much I've Felix as a person. Mans has been the most wholesome dude on this platform. Like damn man, I wish I could go back to the beginning to experience  him grow again. Always looked up to your Mr. PewDiePie Sir lol
Felix complimenting Marzia on her hair was so cute, need someone to notice little things like that and appreciate /sobbing/
its hard to believe ive watched this mans whole life almost. ive been watching since 2011. love you felix <3
It just fucks with my head. Seeing how Felix and Marzia is doing today. I started watching PewDiePie 11 years ago now, at that time I was 13, I'm 24 now and Im still watching him, damn what a trip!
Dang Felix, it's so crazy to see your progress in life both physically and internally, you know...  just as a person, at least since watching you back in like 2012. Cheers.
Pewd's "Living in Japan" Arc has been so wholesome. All the love to you and yours
Maybe you already know, or maybe not, in Japan you have to register your bikes as well ^_^.

I’ve never seen someone smile so much while saying “everything’s going wrong”
So happy you’re happy Pewds
This is the kind of vlogs that entertains me - no screaming, no overly fast-paced transitions, no stupid sound effects, just get to see Pewds living his life normally and respectfully as well.
felix is living one of the best lives possible right now. when he's like 70 he's gonna be able to look back at so many memories.
Pewdiepie is literally the definition of “doing the side quests after you beat the game”
I genuinely love the fact that he looks extremely happy in these vlogs. You can easily tell how comfortable he is there and it honestly warms my heart seeing pewds smiling :)

Those blogs are super meditating. 
Can't wait to get to Japan as well. This really helps a lot!
them bringing Edgar and Maya out in public with a stroller, gets me every time

From watching Pewds playing happy wheels to now seeing him living in Tokyo with his wife and dogs. It’s so crazy how quick time went by but so good to see him and Marzia happy and living life to the fullest
He feels like he's actually so happy, it makes me happy whenever he acomplises his dream. It's great when you see pewds having a great time
that whole 3 minutes of pewds being so adorable playing with a mantis is just too wholesome..

Look how far we've gotten, from playing Amnesia in a little apartment with a little laptop and camera to Pewds Does Everything, to Pewds getting a girlfriend! To pewds getting 1 millions subs and then getting through tough times and then millions of subs and here we are..  I'm a proud watcher for many many years. I'm happy that he is happy
Seeing Felix so happy is so fucking wholesome
After years of hard work and controversies, pewds has retired to the land he always wanted and finally seems at peace. What a character arc.
I dont watch Pewd’s videos that much anymore but man this made me cry. I love how he’s enjoying himself in Japan. He’s having one helleva time living his dream. The guy deserves it.

14:06 A green one is "Shitajiki" which you place under papers to press Hanko smoothly. A red one is, yes like you said, a kind of refill of ink pad "syuniku". We usually it at home instead of syuniku in hanko case, because ink in hanko case is few. Ink in hanko case is usually used when you cannot find any other syuniku for emergency or outside the house as portable syuniku. I hope you'll enjoy Japan :)

Felix, it is very nice to see that you're living up to your dreams and determined whilst unafraid to try new things. Something as big as moving to Japan must be really scary and unknown for most people, but I believe you have some experience with it there. It's also really nice to see that there was a bike you were excited about. I like to see that when people are happy over smaller things in life like a bicycle, that is good. Fulfilling.

I swear Pewds has such a relaxed style of vlogging. It feels so personal and relaxing, like catching up with an old friend.
I hope he keeps it up

You know there is just something very wholesome about PewDiePie enjoying his new life at a place where it feels like he can live happy. This is something we should all appreciate because throughout the many years PewDiePie has been through on YouTube, it is very nice to see him showing us how he is doing at Japan making it very clear that this is something that brought him to a new era.
I really love the new content! Followed Pewds for a decade and it feels really good to experience part of his and Marzia’s life. ️
Haven't watched pewds in months. I saw he didn't make meme contents anymore. Came back to his channel and saw epic vlogs, gonna continue watching him

The guy who said "please enjoy your life in Japan" to Felix also touched me!! They say it with such courteousness and kindness!!
I pictured a kind old Japanese man taking a minute to find the English words and appreciating the patronage of Felix!!
Pewds seems to be mentally home... and it brings me peace seeing this... after all these years of growing up.
Yes we want a setup Tour
I feel like crying everytime pewds shows edgar and maya on the screen, the little babies grew up
00:49 - I love how marzia pointing at herself waiting to be included in getting a bicycle
I love that all the "failures" are documented as well during this whole process of settling. I'm planning to move soon myself and this is very wholesome. Reassuring in a way

I couldn't help smiling when you said "ごめんなさい(I'm sorry)" to a mantis. You have such a kind heart. 
Thank you for coming to my country.
You grew to be such a great person man. Everybody’s saying it but it’s so true. We love you
Props to pewds for turning into an actual adult and not some LA “too cool for you” type of person after success.

It’s insane how we’re all genuinely enjoying watching pewds start his new life in Japan.  

Thank you Felix for continuing to make my favorite videos to enjoy

You can use your new hanko as a “mitomein” or an everyday hanko!

The hanko you have to register to the town hall is a “jitsuin” and is the most important hanko. It’s used for situations like buying real estate, cars, renting apartments, etc. There is also a “ginkouin” or bank hanko which you register at the bank and is used for large withdrawals, making credit cards, opening accounts, etc. Not all banks need this so it depends on your bank. 

When it’s not a formal case, people might still ask for a hanko. You can use your “mitomein” or daily hanko in those cases like for example when you get a package delivered!

It’s recommended to have each of these hankos. If you use one hanko for all purposes and you lose it, it could be a problem. If you ever want to change hankos, you can always bring your new and old hanko and go to the bank or town hall and ask for a change  
If you want to make new hankos or are confused which kind works for which situation, the super nice hanko shop will probably know best!
can we all just appreciate how my man Felix is just enjoying life and we get to see him do so..hella fun
From getting terrified by horror games to spending a relaxing day with pewds. You are my savior, Pewds,
insane how much i smile when i see a couple i never met with their dogs just roaming around a country i  never visited and still feel so conected.. its been 10 years watching this family growing.

I love that pewds is loving life in Japan! When I first lived in Japan, we went through hoops like that too. And yes electric bikes ftw, I have one too and it makes living in a hilly Japanese town just like living in an anime.
目黒川の近くですね！来年の春になったらもう一度同じ場所に行ってみてください！何故かは行けばわかるはず
i love these japan vlogs, keep making it pleasee
11:14 "insect-kun, gomenasai" this man
I am so happy for you and Marzia being able to live in Japan finally. The wait has definitely been worth it!
i live in japan as well and i'm super happy to hear you moved here as well!! it's currently a rainy season now (Tsuyu, 梅雨 (つゆ) ) but after that it should be super sunny (and hot)
i’ve watched his content mature through the years and i feel like we the viewers matured with felix as well! i really enjoy this minimalist japan vlogs so much keep it up pewds

It's so wild to see him now compared to when I started watching him back in like 2011-2012, he's accomplished so much and it makes me extremely happy to see how far he's come and the life he's created with Marzia
this series of him living in Japan is the series that makes me don't want the video to end every single one of them super fun and chill
Felix befriending that praying mantis was so sweet!!! Those guys get SO big here! I love seeing them so small and watching them day by day grow!
It must feel so crazy for pewdiepie to walk around in public without people constantly coming up to him. It must be such a great feeling
I just love how he casually compliments Marzia's hair (which is gorgeous, as always). That's just love. :)
it’s astonishing i’ve seen his videos for literally more than half my life(i’m 17) and man i remember happy wheels, screaming at barrels, skate 3 and it’s amazing to see his life now
maya looked like she was absolutely living for that bike ride, enjoying the wind on her face. great vid thank you again
Marzia pointing at herself when you didn’t say she gets a bicycle so so adorable
pewds looks so much happier with his current style of videos
Following you on this journey is amazing! Thanks for filming all this!
I normally am not a commentor on YouTube but these Japan vlogs are saving my life I love them so much

He has never really looked sad b4 but now he truly seems to be super happy, good for u pewds "have a happy life in japan".
God... I no longer watch pewds but just seeing how has grown. since,  I was 11-12 years old (21 now) makes me feel nostalgic. Happy for you pewds live your life and love everything.

The Fact that Felix made it from being in a room, playing in his Guitar to succeding and actually getting to live in Japan just makes me happy
I get the feeling that Marzia is the one editing these vlogs and I'm living for it. So glad to see you adapting to your new life, you guys deserve the very best

Also, is the new member the bikes, the praying mantis, the car??
Your happiness is contagious ^^
These vlogs remind me of Marzia’s old videos which I miss so much :’) keep it up pewds! Much love to you both

Ps: Its good to see Pewds happy with a Toyota haha

you know, i think that Felix and Marzia are going to do well in Japan. as someone who lives in Japan, I think that their relaxed and agreeable personalities will fit in well. there are a lot of bureaucratic things that seem unnecessarily complicated, but it seems like those two have the patience to bear it out, plus the good worldview to appreciate all the great and beautiful parts of Japan

still remember when i started watching pewds when he was playing amnesia, what an inspiring journey. He went from my favourite gaming youtuber years ago to my favourite vlogger today

Edit: wow thx for the likes
